page.title: 02FORESTRY
page.content:
{FORESTRY}
Forestry is one of the few sources of employment on Skye today and covers a large percentage of the land area.
The main types are coniferous especially the fir and pine varieties.
These are planted in large plantations with large gaps separating sections of trees. These are called fire breaks. Only a small quantity of the timber is used for commercial use. This is due to the high costs of transportation
Every ten years or so the trees are thinned out giving them more room to grow.This is a very time consuming and expensive occupation but has the advantage of providing welcomed employment to the local community.
